caption: Great atmosphere, great food and cocktails, and fricken killer Italian hip, trip hop. Really enjoyed

one of the best Italian spots I have been to in a LONG time. If you're looking for food that simply just tastes good, you've found it. Any of the white pizza's... YUM. If you're ordering takeout I highly recommend getting it well done . The Farfalle alla Vodka pasta dish I have to get EVERY single time. It's so simple but done so well it's a must try. They also have a lot of Montenegro Amaro specialty drinks which are . Will continue to support this spot for years to come. I live by ORD and drive to Old Town to support this place. Delicious food, great service.

Had a great experience at Gallucci’s this week!  Started off with the fried seafood, the breading was perfect. The pizzas are cooked in a wood fire oven. We tried the Calabrese, the one with truffles and the award winning pizza. Each one was delicious and kept us wanting more. The service was great too, family owned so supporting them (small business) is important.  The variety of wine gave our group lots of choices. Will definitely be back. 5 stars for the Gallucci’s boys.
Best Pizza 🍕,  fantastic!!!
Had reservation and still had to wait 30 minutes. Good wine selection.
Pizza was fantastic. Gianni is always an amazing host and makes sure every evening is special. The Aglianico TerreStregate was an excellent red wine that paired perfectly with the food.

As far as Neapolitan pizza goes, Gallucci has that down. I'm usually more of a red pizza fan but we wanted to try both a white and a red so we went with the Tartufata for white and the Calabrese for red and boy was I impressed! The white pizza is hard to put into words as the ingredients were so unique and each bite had so much flavor.

Hands down my favorite Neapolitan pizza I have had in the city! Ordered the Montanarine Fritte, Tagliatelle Bolognese, Margherita pizzza, Regina pizza, and Angioletti Fritti (nutella bites). Everything was delicious. The only item i wouldn't order again was the pasta because the bolognese sauce was nothing special (although the pasta was freshly homemade). I would just opt for another pizza for the group instead. 11/10 and happy to found my new local spot!

Enjoyed a delicious dinner at Gallucci in their outdoor patio! I tried the prosciutto and arugula pizza and the pistachio pesto pizza with sausage and honey. The crust was yeasty, perfectly crispy and nicely charred. The toppings were fresh and the pizza was perfectly cooked. The service was good and the wine list featured lots of nice Italian options. Definitely check out Gallucci!

Gf and I ended up leaving after waiting 20 minutes for someone to come to our table. Just me and the girl. Never even got food or drinks. We live a block away too and would have come back this place looked great on the reviews. Very disappointed!  Stay away if you’re looking for pizza/Italian places in old town..OR IF YOU WANT GOD AWFUL SERVICE LOL...  I suggest Orso’s or maybe Topo Gigio right across the street from this place.  Trust me on that one.

Would love to at least be able to comment on the food but unfortunately I didn’t even get to that portion of my night with this place. Showed up on time for my 7pm reservation and knew I was in for it when reservations from 6:15 were still waiting for a table. Waited for 15 mins to simply check in for my reservation while the host frantically ran in and out of the restaurant and ignored everyone waiting to check in for their reservations. We finally got sat down and then waited for a solid 20 mins for someone to at least acknowledge we were there...that moment never came. After the 20 min wait I walked back inside and told the host we hadn’t had anyone come to our table yet and instead of resolving the issue, he told me “this is why I didn’t want to sit you down right away, I knew no one would be able to come to your table.” What’s the point of making a reservation? To be told that I’m basically an inconvenience for showing up on time for my reservation was unreal. We decided to walk out after that and since it was a Friday night in old town during a pandemic, we weren’t able to make a reservation anywhere else and had to scrap our date night all together.
Nice place with outdoor seating. The pizza was not incredible, neither was the burrata. You can definitely find better options in the area.
The pasta and pizza were amazing as well as the service!

Pizza looked great in the photos but arrived to our table wet with water from the tomatoes (we assumed) which left our bottom crust almost inedible. No striking flavors, overall decent.  Service was friendly, almost overly attentive, but we were there late. Most members of the wait staff followed COVID-19 protocol and wore their masks correctly.
Tasty pizza, decent price, quick service.

This is one of my family's favorites.  They have a number of different types of pizzas, so you should be able to find something you like.  They place a great deal of effort into the crust.  Generally I find that the crust is what makes the difference when differentiating between a good and a great pizza.  My wife almost always orders the Pizza Calabrese (and not just because that is our name).  I generally like their various vegetarian style pizzas.  If you like strong flavors, get the Citara, which has a strong anchovy and caper taste.  My other favorite is the Terra Mia.  They have a number of white pizzas.  One interesting one to try is the Sorrentina, which has sliced lemons (best during warm summer nights).  They offer a few pasta dishes.  The pasta is good, but the focus is on the pizza  The cocktail menu is interesting, combining classic cocktails with new ideas.  Try the Pulcinella cocktail.  They also have a good wine list.  For antipasto, try the Treccia, which is a braided mozzarella served with wood fired cherry tomatoes.  For dessert, my family loves the  pizza dough with nutella.  The service is good, the people friendly.  It is a welcome addition to Old Town
Pizza was very good!!

I had a reservation at 8.30, drove 30 min to get there, and when I step in I am greeted with “we are closing”. I explained that I had a reservation at 8.30 and then was asked to wait for a sec. Another server comes up to us and asks that we step outside so they can take my temperature and we did. Waited for 2 minutes before the same guy came out and said “We are out of dough”. If you know you have more reservations coming you don’t prepare more dough? You don’t give them a call and ask them not to come in? I am not even sure that was a the real reasoning - what Italian restaurant runs out of dough? None of them seemed truly apologetic or astonished by the situation.  The reason this ruined the night is that we were in busy Old Town and every place was packed. We literally called 5 restaurants hoping for a late night reservation and ended up going north for food.

I can’t say enough about this place .  The staff, the food , and the facility are just amazing .  I want to throw a party here .   I am looking forward to coming here for special occasion or no reason at all .   Thank you Gallucci pizza for Keeping family businesses alive and kicking !
(Translated by Google) Teststitity  (Original) تستستيتيتيتي

Was really excited to try this place but was an overall underwhelming experience. Sit outside if possible, the inside just has a very interesting vibe to it. We ordered the Frittura di Peace to start which was good except the shrimp tasted off. We had the Calabrese for pizza which was good, but overall was not as spicy as advertise and could have used a bit longer in the oven, the middle was floppier than other Neopolitans we've had.  Would love to try again but not sure if we will since it's not the cheapest place around.

Excellent Neapolitan pizza. First time here and I have been waiting for this to open. They were supposed to open in March, but pandemic pushed it. I had their award winner pizza (Terra Mia) which is basically a Margarita with extra cherry tomatoes and Mozzarella di Bufala from Naples. Roberto gave me some Spicy Olive oil to dip the crust into and it's really quite tasty. I can't wait to go back. This joins SpaccaNapoli, Forno Rosso and La Pizza at Eataly, in my local triumvirate for Neapolitan pizza.
Great pizza and salads, impeccable service!
Very good pizza and friendly stuff
Best pizza in a long~~~~ time. So fresh and delicious! Five stars are not enough
Excellent pizza! Highly recommend the sausage, pistachio, and pesto pizza. Great service, ambiance, and a lot of outdoor seating!
Delicious pizza. Super fresh ingredients and great menu.
Definitely in the running for best pizza in Old Town. Their pizzas are personal size and just perfect. An almost perfect crust on the pizzas baked in a wood fired oven.

Ordered carry out from here and it was delicious!!! The staff made sure that my arrival timed out well with my pizza being ready, as this style of pizza doesn’t seem like it is meant to sit for a while... and trust me it didn’t 😋 I ordered the Biancalana and it was SO good the crust was amazing and the flavors were fresh and delicious! The buratta was very yummy as well! Can’t wait to come back and try out more pizzas!
for those who want to taste the real Italian pizza this is the best in Chicago

undercooked, overpriced. As a local was really rooting for this place to do well after Dinotto’s left, instead am left bitterly dissapointed how I end up paying 30$ for a personal pizza that is soggy and tasteless. Hope they make some improvements because I really wanted to like this place.

We ordered from Gallucci for the first time through Grubhub and it was the best pizza we've eaten in Chicago. We had the baked burrata, margherita pizza, and tartufata pizza. Highly recommend this place.

We gave Gallucci a try before a show at 2nd City and were very glad we did. Started with the Frittura di Pesce-delish. The batter was light and the seafood cooked perfectly. On to the B & B salad which features my favorite ingredient-burrata. Four of us shared two pizzas, a white and a red, Biancalana and Calabrese-both fantastic. Loved that the owner stopped by the table. Fun to see a chef so excited and proud of his new restaurant. The service was a little too much, our plates were whisked away almost before we were finished with our food. Great, buzzy atmosphere and loved the oversized painted murals. We will be back for sure!

Came in with friends as I had been wanting to check it out since opening.  We started with the Treccia di Bufala which was incredible. I wanted to eat the whole thing by myself.  For mains, we went with two pizze bianchi: Tartufata (w/ a GF crust) and Biancalana and one rosse: Terra Mia.  The Biancalana was my favourite of the three but all were great.  Only downside was that we were not aware of the GF crust up charge until the bill arrived. One of our party has celiac so she was very excited about the GF offering but was a bit disappointed that there was no mention of an up charge beforehand.  Otherwise, I will definitely be coming back and absolutely recommending it to others.  Great addition to the neighbourhood.

Summary...fantastic. Food check. Service check. Decor check.  The gnocchi were cooked perfectly. Our table had 3 pizze and all were fantastic - the Norma the sausage pistachio and the margherita...plus a nice primativo.
Best pizza
A must visit !  Wall art amazing. Beautifully renovated - kuddos to the owner’s style. Split the arugula salad and Tagliatelle dish with my gf -EXCeLLENT! paired with a glass of red. Pizza is next!

After visiting many Neopolitan Pizzeria's throughout the city and suburbs I can honestly say that this was the best of the bunch.  Arrived Sunday with a party of 4 and we're sat immediately.  The ambiance is great, as to be expected of a restaurant in Old Town.  To start, we had the insalata dimare (sp?) all the seafood was cooked perfectly not chewy but not undercooked.  We split the Gnocci entree,also, as an appetizer, that was equally impressive.  The pizzas were the true shining star. each one as delicious as the last.  Looking forward to trying every pizza on the menu.  Keep up the good work, Gallucci!
The pizza is perfect.   As much as I loved our old spot, Gallucci is a great neighborhood restaurant.  I highly recommend.   In addition to great food, service is impeccable.
